channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: A recent FBI-led raid at an Idaho race track shows how immigration is driving federal law enforcement under the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Boone, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — As Republicans accuse Democrats of tolerating antisemitism in their party, the GOP on Friday was roiled by its own schism after the leader of a powerful right-wing think tank defended prominent conservative commentator Tucker Carlson for his friendly podcast interview with a far-righ
item.dc:creator: NICHOLAS RICCARDI, JILL COLVIN and THOMAS BEAUMONT, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Missing 13-year-old Louisana girl found in Pittsburgh basement
item.description: During questioning, investigators learned he had been with the girl at the Greyhound Bus Station in Baton Rouge earlier that week.
item.dc:creator: Trinity Velazquez, NewsNation

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger’s cash clash, Luigi Mangione's street cred, DC sniper's reveal
item.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Nation’s largest airlines press Democrats to pass funding stopgap to reopen government
item.description: Four of the nation’s largest airlines are pressing Senate Democrats to pass a clean stopgap spending bill to reopen the government amidst growing delays at airports around the country caused by staffing issues linked to the expiration of government funding a month ago.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Top blue city university's newspaper tracks ICE operations amid frequent violent clashes with feds
item.description: University of Chicago student newspaper launches interactive ICE tracking map, soliciting community tips on federal immigration enforcement activities in local neighborhoods.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Last-minute scramble over pay takes a toll on military families during the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The government shutdown is exacting a heavy mental toll on the nation's military families, leaving them not knowing from week to week whether their paychecks will arrive.
item.dc:creator: BEN FINLEY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: EMINENCE, Ky. (AP) — Allan Bryant scans the sky as he watches over a minutes-old calf huddled under a tree line with its mother. After a few failed tries, the calf stands on wobbly legs for the first time, looking to nurse. Above, a pair of birds circle in the distance.
item.dc:creator: JOSHUA A. BICKEL and MELINA WALLING, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: The Latest: Trump administration must fund SNAP payments during the shutdown, judges rule
item.description: Federal judges have ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Fast chargers are expanding quickly, but American EV drivers still fear running out of juice
item.description: KENT, Conn. (AP) — For most Americans, there’s less reason than ever to worry about finding chargers to fuel up an electric vehicle. But charging worries remain a top hesitation for potential buyers, second only to sticker shock. Those concerns linger even as fast chargers multiply.
item.dc:creator: M.K. WILDEMAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Why some schools have been spooked out of Halloween
item.description: Religion, politics and student participation are all among the reasons some schools have abandoned Halloween celebrations that put candy-filled children in bulky costumes in classrooms.
item.dc:creator: Lexi Lonas Cochran, KRON4

item.title: Jim McGreevey is back on the ballot, 21 years after scandal led him to resign as New Jersey governor
item.description: JERSEY CITY, N.J. (AP) — Two decades after resigning as New Jersey’s governor and stunning the political world as he declared “I am a gay American," Jim McGreevey is back on the campaign trail, running for mayor of the state’s second-largest city.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. SISAK, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: 2 die in flooded New York City basements during heavy rainstorm
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump calls on Republicans to use 'nuclear option' and get rid of Senate filibuster
item.description: President Trump called on Senate Republicans on Thursday to initiate the "nuclear option" and get rid of the filibuster, which would allow them to end the government shutdown and pass legislation with a simple majority.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: National Guard in each state is ordered to create 'quick reaction forces' trained in civil unrest
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Military leaders have ordered the National Guard in every state to develop a “quick reaction force” of troops trained to deal with civil disturbances and riots that can be ready to deploy with just hours' notice, the latest indication of longer-term Trump administration plans to mo
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Louisiana deputy accused of orchestrating inmate-on-inmate attack
item.description: Danny C. Taylor, 40, is facing serious charges after allegedly directing an inmate to assault another inmate.
item.dc:creator: Erykah Agers, NewsNation

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, NewsNation

item.title: Pair get prison for assaulting restaurant host over where they were seated
item.description: The teenager who was attacked said the trouble began after he finally got them all seated at the one large table.
item.dc:creator: Sarai Bennett, NewsNation

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, WGN 9

item.title: US will share tech to let South Korea build a nuclear-powered submarine, Trump says
item.description: GYEONGJU, South Korea (AP) — The United States will share closely held technology to allow South Korea to build a nuclear-powered submarine, President Donald Trump said on social media Thursday after meeting with the country’s president.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS MEGERIAN and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Jury convicts California activist who took chickens from Perdue Farms plant
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — A California animal rights activist who took four chickens from a major Perdue Farms poultry plant was found guilty Wednesday of felony conspiracy, trespassing and other charges and faces several years in jail.
item.dc:creator: OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: How to find food if your SNAP benefits are cut off
item.description: Unless something changes dramatically in the next couple days, more than 40 million Americans are preparing to have federal food assistance cut off starting Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, Fox 5

item.title: Russian mobsters sentenced to 25 years for foiled plot to assassinate Iranian dissident journalist
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Two purported Russian mobsters were each sentenced to 25 years behind bars Wednesday for hiring a hitman to kill Iranian American journalist Masih Alinejad at her Brooklyn home three years ago on behalf of the Iranian government.
item.dc:creator: LARRY NEUMEISTER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Suspects disguised as construction workers sought in $3.2 million jewelry heist in NYC
item.description: Three people, including two disguised as construction workers, allegedly stole cash and jewelry worth approximately $3.2 million from a home in New York City earlier this month, police said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Fine, WGN 9

item.title: Trump administration moves to overrule state laws protecting credit reports from medical debt
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The Trump administration is moving to overrule any state laws that may protect consumers’ credit reports from medical debt and other debt issues.
item.dc:creator: KEN SWEET, Associated Press, ABC 4
